“The people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world are the ones who do.”
- Apple's "Think Different" Commercial, 1997

I usually go to places as a group. We would see garbage spreading on the ground. As I was observing, I would see my friends or classmates would walk across them, some even stepped on them and acted like there was nothing there. Everyone at that age has heard at least once about global warming or the effect of wasted plastics. Even in worse cases, some even threw the rubbish randomly wherever they want and in the classroom under their own table, they just ignore it and wait until the cleaner does the job for them.returned to rescue it from near bankruptcy in 1997, and by the time he died, in October 2011, had built it into the world’s most valuable company. Along the way he helped to transform seven industries: personal computing, animated movies, music, phones, tablet computing, retail stores, and digital publishing. He thus belongs in the pantheon of America’s great innovators, along with Thomas Edison, Henry Ford, and Walt Disney.
